data.fullContent: Red meat is any meat that is red when raw, including beef, veal, pork, and mutton. The red color is the result of natural pigments called myoglobin. The darker the pigment of the meat, the more myoglobin it contains. Other animals such as fish, shellfish, and insects do have red muscle tissue, but they are not considered to be red meat. The most important nutritional role meat serves is its content of protein. Protein is involved in many critical activities throughout the body, including the maintenance and repair of body tissues. A diet that is too high in protein, especially from red meat, can lead to kidney damage if an individual's kidneys are not able to sufficiently process the excess protein. Many health care professionals recommend that individuals who are not regularly physically active limit their consumption of red meat to one or two portions per week.

q1.translation: 红肉是指任何生的时候呈红色的肉，包括牛肉、小牛肉、猪肉和羊肉。红色是一种叫做肌红蛋白的天然色素的结果。
q1.front: Red meat is any meat that is red when raw, including beef, veal, pork, and mutton. The red color is the result of natural pigments called myoglobin.
q1.content: Red meat is any meat that ____ red ____ raw, ____ beef, veal, pork, and mutton. The red color is the result of natural pigments called myoglobin.

q2.translation: 红肉是指任何生的时候呈红色的肉，包括牛肉、小牛肉、猪肉和羊肉。红色是一种叫做肌红蛋白的天然色素的结果。肉的颜色越深，含有的肌红蛋白就越多。鱼类、贝类和昆虫等其他动物也有红色肌肉组织，但它们不被认为是红肉。肉类最重要的营养作用是它的蛋白质含量。蛋白质参与全身许多重要活动，包括身体组织的维护和修复。饮食中蛋白质含量过高，尤其是红肉，如果一个人的肾脏不能充分处理多余的蛋白质，就会导致肾脏损伤。许多保健专家建议，不经常锻炼身体的人，每周限制红肉的摄入量为一到两份。
q2.front: Red meat is any meat that is red when raw, including beef, veal, pork, and mutton. The red color is the result of natural pigments called myoglobin.
q2.middle: The darker the pigment of the meat, the more myoglobin it contains.
q2.ending: Other animals such as fish, shellfish, and insects do have red muscle tissue, but they are not considered to be red meat. The most important nutritional role meat serves is its content of protein. Protein is involved in many critical activities throughout the body, including the maintenance and repair of body tissues. A diet that is too high in protein, especially from red meat, can lead to kidney damage if an individual's kidneys are not able to sufficiently process the excess protein. Many health care professionals recommend that individuals who are not regularly physically active limit their consumption of red meat to one or two portions per week.
